title: Sculpture by the Lakes Pallington Walk Route

images.title: Trish Steel, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Electricity for Weymouth. The electricity pylons march across the landscape on their way to Weymouth. The River Frome and its surrounding ponds can also be seen.

description: This beautiful sculpture park in Dorchester is one of the major highlights of the region. There are 26 acres to explore on good footpaths, taking you around and between the pretty Pallington Lakes. The lakes are surrounded by lovely meadows and there is a stunning, beautifully designed garden too. It's a great place for an easy afternoon stroll with several fine sculptures by Simon Gudgeon to see. You can easily extend your walk by heading to the nearby Pallington Heath where there are miles of woodland walking trails. The Jubilee Trail also runs past the lakes so you could pick this up to extend your outing.

details.subtitle: Further Information and Other Local Ideas
details.content: Just to the north east you can pick up the Bere Regis Walk and visit Moreton, Bovington Heath and Clouds Hill, the former home of Lawrence of Arabia. Near here there's the Winfrith Newburgh Heath and Tadnoll Nature Reserves. The reserves include miles of peaceful heathland trails with lots of wildlife and a splendid viewpoint. For more walking ideas in the area see the Dorset Walks page.

display_address: B3390, Hurst, Moreton, Dorset, England, DT2 8RB, United Kingdom
